items.content: You don’t need more code.
You need software
that can handle complexity —  in the tech and in the team.

button.linkTitle: Let’s explore what that could look like  →

items.content:
Most software projects don’t fail because the tech is wrong. They fail because complexity is underestimated, and the human side of the work is left unsupported.


That’s why we design systems that evolve with your mission and the people building it with you.
Purpose-built software  for meaningful change

You have a bold vision for impact. We build software that moves that vision forward.


Purpose-built technology doesn’t just solve problems — it changes systems, organizations, and people for the better.


And we’re structured to build that kind of change into every sprint.
Trusted by visionary leaders

title: About Us

items.content: We develop people and technology to become an ever-expanding force for good.

At Speed & Function, we believe technology should evolve with the people building and using it, not just meet a spec.


Our goal is to help mission-driven organizations create real impact by working better: more aligned, more adaptive, and more human.


That’s why we’ve spent the last 17+ years developing not just custom software — but more intentional teams, stronger partnerships, and systems that last.


We’re also a Deliberately Developmental Organization (DDO), which means feedback, reflection, and shared ownership are built into how we work. Internally and externally, we create environments where growth is expected, supported, and embedded in how we deliver.


We partner with purpose-driven teams who want more than output. They want long-term thinking, thoughtful collaboration, and a process that helps everyone evolve.
Here’s what we value most:
Every project is a chance to grow: as engineers, partners, and people.
True integration means shared context, shared tools, and shared responsibility.
Growth requires change. We build teams and systems that respond well to both.
We follow through, speak up, and stay aligned even when things get messy.

title: About Us

items.content: We develop people and technology to become an ever-expanding force for good.

At Speed & Function, we believe technology should evolve with the people building and using it, not just meet a spec.


Our goal is to help mission-driven organizations create real impact by working better: more aligned, more adaptive, and more human.


That’s why we’ve spent the last 17+ years developing not just custom software — but more intentional teams, stronger partnerships, and systems that last.


We’re also a Deliberately Developmental Organization (DDO), which means feedback, reflection, and shared ownership are built into how we work. Internally and externally, we create environments where growth is expected, supported, and embedded in how we deliver.


We partner with purpose-driven teams who want more than output. They want long-term thinking, thoughtful collaboration, and a process that helps everyone evolve.
Here’s what we value most:
Every project is a chance to grow: as engineers, partners, and people.
True integration means shared context, shared tools, and shared responsibility.
Growth requires change. We build teams and systems that respond well to both.
We follow through, speak up, and stay aligned even when things get messy.

title: Built Differently

items.content: People problems  are tech problems.  We solve both.
Most software failures don’t happen in the code. They happen in the gaps between teams, unclear expectations, shifting priorities, and short-term thinking.
We work differently.
Our approach is built for complexity — with long-term partnership, adaptive delivery, and developmental practices that help people grow alongside the systems they build.
What that looks like:
We operate like part of your team, with shared context and priorities.
Our delivery model adapts as your needs shift, without losing momentum.
Every sprint grows both the product and the people building it.
We evolve strategy in real time, without derailing progress.
With 900+ launches and a 95% retention rate, we’ve helped organizations turn complexity into momentum — and teams into trusted collaborators.

title: Solutions

items.content: We build software that  fits your needs — and your future.
From scratch builds to complex integrations, we create technology that supports your growth over time.
Whether you're starting fresh, evolving an existing product, or untangling legacy complexity — we build to fit the way your team actually works.
Our experience spans:
Cloud-based applications built for scale, stability, and multi-tenant environments.
Our delivery model adapts as your needs shift, without losing momentum.
Every sprint grows both the product and the people building it.
Content-heavy, high-traffic sites engineered for performance and long-term maintainability.
Best practices and implementation across code, infrastructure, and architecture layers.
Modern DevOps and cloud-native setup to ensure performance, resilience, and scalability.
Sustained support to evolve and adapt your software as needs change.
Every engagement is built to scale with you, from first release to future roadmap.
Choose the partnership model that’s right for you.
We offer four ways to engage, from project-based execution to full integration.
End-to-end software development managed by our team — so you can focus on your core business.
Fractional roles that flex with your needs. Integrated, adaptable, and scalable.
Specialized contributors embedded with your team for long-term support and continuity.
A complete tech organization embedded into your systems and culture. Combines the consistency of a long-term partner with the flexibility to evolve as you scale.

title: How We Deliver

items.content: What it takes to build something that lasts.
Building and maintaining software in complex environments takes more than good code. It requires shared understanding, adaptability, and a system that supports growth — for people and for products.
Our delivery model is built on three core practices.
They form the foundation of our Technology Organization as a Service (TOaaS) model, but we bring them into every engagement where long-term partnership is the goal.
We operate as a Deliberately Developmental Organization, with built-in systems for feedback, reflection, and growth — for people and for products.
Scalable team models that flex with your pace and priorities — while maintaining continuity and clarity.
Clear context, shared tools, integrated workflows, and real trust — across teams, systems, and decisions.

title: Adam Sandler

items.content: “As a 50-year-old water engineer, I’ve seen my fair share of tech solutions, but this app is a game-changer. The ability to access device data offline and seamlessly sync with the cloud when online has transformed how we work in the field. Your team delivered exactly what we needed—efficient, reliable, and intuitive. Thank you for making our jobs easier!”

title: Watts Water Technologies
stack: React Native, Realm, Firebase, AWS Batch Jobs, ApostropheCMS, BetterStack
descriptor: Delivered a mobile app for water engineers to access device data offline and sync with cloud when online.
objective: Develop mobile app for offline water data access. Create UI for device data management.
challenge: Synchronize offline data for water devices. Manage a complex stakeholder environment.
solution: Used React Native for mobile app. Integrated Realm for offline data sync. Delivered cross-brand UI library.
results: Enhanced field technician efficiency with mobile data access. App enables offline data access. Data syncs automatically when online.

title: Careers

items.content: Come build with us.

Because we’re a Deliberately Developmental Organization, your growth isn’t a byproduct. It’s built into the model. We invest in the people behind the platforms: with feedback, trust, and room to evolve.


If you’re looking for more than just a job, we’d love to hear from you.
We’re not hiring right now.
But we’re always open to great people. Feel free to check back.

title: Let's talk

items.content: We’d love to hear what you’re building.
Or what’s not working. Or where you’re stuck. We’re here for all of it.

We work with teams who are ready to build more aligned systems, stronger partnerships, and software that can hold real complexity.


If that sounds like you — or you’re curious what that kind of partnership could look like — let’s talk.
